title: Gradient Sentinel
description: Grades an ML Training & Evaluation Incident Runbook: splits, diagnostics, experiments, and production thinking.
llm_judge_instructions: Review the entrant's Incident Runbook. Awards points for correct data split design (avoiding leakage), precise diagnosis of training curves (over/underfitting), disciplined experimentation with baselines, and production-ready monitoring plans.
autofail_conditions: Fails to address data leakage or split design
Fails to produce a structured runbook

dimensions.label: Data Checks & Split Design
dimensions.description: Does the player correctly reason about data quality and train/val/test splits (and time-based splits when relevant)?

bands.label: Shallow
bands.criteria: Barely inspects data; treats metrics as absolute truth. No mention of stratification or time-based splits. Ignores potential leakage.

bands.label: Partial
bands.criteria: Performs some checks but misses key leakage or distribution issues. Talks about train/val/test but not how they are constructed.

bands.label: Robust
bands.criteria: Shows clear awareness of leakage, split strategies (e.g., time-based), and basic validation. Checks label balance and feature ranges.

dimensions.label: Training Loop & Metric Diagnostics
dimensions.description: Can the player read training curves and logs and map them to plausible issues and fixes?

bands.label: Guesswork
bands.criteria: Proposes random hyperparameter changes. Ignores obvious signals (e.g., loss divergence, NaNs). No mention of overfitting patterns.

bands.label: Decent Intuition
bands.criteria: Recognizes some patterns (e.g. overfitting) but reasoning is incomplete. Vague fixes or ignores metrics other than loss.

bands.label: Targeted Diagnostics
bands.criteria: Reads curves/logs and proposes specific interventions. Connects flat loss to LR/init/bugs. Uses appropriate metrics (ROC/PR).

dimensions.label: Baselines, Experiments & Ablation Design
dimensions.description: Does the plan include strong baselines and a clear experiment strategy?

bands.label: Ad Hoc
bands.criteria: Jumps to complex models without baselines. Experiments are one-off tweaks with no structure.

bands.label: Some Structure
bands.criteria: Mentions baselines or experiments but with limited discipline. A/B-ish tests without clear metrics or stopping criteria.

bands.label: Disciplined Experimenter
bands.criteria: Defines baselines (simple models), ablations, and clear comparison criteria. Starts simple to sanity-check data.

dimensions.label: Production Monitoring & Retraining Plan
dimensions.description: Does the runbook think beyond offline training to monitoring, drift, and safe retraining?

bands.label: Offline Only
bands.criteria: Considers only offline metrics. No mention of drift, calibration, or live metrics. Assumes training once is enough.

bands.label: Basic Awareness
bands.criteria: Mentions monitoring/drift at a high level. Does not distinguish offline validation from online evaluation.

bands.label: Ops-Ready
bands.criteria: Provides a concrete strategy: key metrics (calibration, FNR), thresholds, retraining cadence, and rollback path.

grade_bands.label: Warden's Favorite
grade_bands.description: Perfect execution across all dimensions, showing senior engineering judgment.

grade_bands.label: Certified Alchemist
grade_bands.description: Strong analysis and planning, minor gaps in edge cases.

grade_bands.label: Gradient Surfer
grade_bands.description: Acceptable diagnostics but lacks depth in production or experiment design.

grade_bands.label: NaN Seeker
grade_bands.description: Fails to grasp the core issues of leakage or stability.
